sections.heading: Immediate Safety
sections.text: Ensure resident safety first; separate parties if needed and notify leadership per policy.

sections.heading: Objective Documentation
sections.text: Document objective findings and resident statement when possible; avoid assumptions or conclusions.

sections.heading: Notifications
sections.text: Notify Administrator/DON and follow the facility reporting workflow; document time, person notified, and outcome.

sections.heading: Injury Assessment
sections.text: Assess and document injuries with location, size, color, and photographs per policy if applicable.

sections.heading: Preservation of Evidence
sections.text: Preserve relevant evidence and maintain chain of custody steps per policy when indicated.

sections.heading: Family/Emergency Contact
sections.text: Notify family/emergency contact per policy unless restricted by investigation guidance; document notification.

sections.heading: Post-Fall Assessment
sections.text: Complete immediate assessment including vital signs, pain, neuro status, and visible injuries; compare to baseline.

sections.heading: Head Strike & Anticoagulants
sections.text: If head strike suspected or resident is on anticoagulant/antiplatelet therapy, escalate per protocol and increase monitoring.

sections.heading: Neuro Checks
sections.text: Initiate neuro checks per protocol/orders when indicated; document frequency, findings, and escalation criteria.

sections.heading: Provider Notification
sections.text: Notify provider using SBAR; document orders received and actions taken.

sections.heading: Family Notification
sections.text: Notify family/emergency contact per policy and document contact and response.

sections.heading: Recognize Change
sections.text: Identify acute change from baseline (mental status, respiratory status, pain, intake, mobility) and initiate focused assessment.

sections.heading: SBAR Communication
sections.text: Use SBAR format for provider notification; include baseline, current findings, and your recommendation/request.

sections.heading: Monitoring
sections.text: Increase monitoring based on severity and provider orders; define what changes require escalation.

sections.heading: Documentation
sections.text: Document time course, objective findings, interventions, response, notifications, and plan.

sections.heading: Standard Precautions
sections.text: Apply Standard Precautions for all residents; perform hand hygiene and use PPE based on anticipated exposure.

sections.heading: Transmission-Based Precautions
sections.text: Initiate Contact/Droplet/Airborne precautions when indicated; post signage and use dedicated equipment as required.

sections.heading: Outbreak Response
sections.text: For suspected outbreak, initiate case tracking/line listing and notify Infection Prevention leadership per policy.

sections.heading: Reporting
sections.text: Follow reporting requirements for communicable diseases/outbreaks and document actions taken.

sections.heading: Skin Assessment
sections.text: Assess skin routinely and with any change in condition; document location, staging/description, drainage, odor, and surrounding tissue.

sections.heading: Prevention
sections.text: Implement prevention: turning/repositioning, offloading, moisture management, nutrition/hydration support.

sections.heading: Treatment
sections.text: Provide wound care per orders/protocol; document dressing type, wound response, and tolerance.

sections.heading: Escalation
sections.text: Escalate for signs of infection or rapid deterioration; notify provider and wound team per policy.

sections.heading: Immediate Response
sections.text: If medication error or suspected adverse drug reaction occurs, assess resident, ensure safety, and notify provider per protocol.

sections.heading: Monitoring
sections.text: Increase monitoring for expected adverse effects; document symptoms, vitals, and response.

sections.heading: Documentation
sections.text: Complete required incident documentation and medication record updates per policy.

sections.heading: Family Notification
sections.text: Notify family/emergency contact as required; document time and response.

sections.heading: Hand Hygiene
sections.text: Perform hand hygiene at key moments (before/after resident contact, after glove removal, after contact with bodily fluids).

sections.heading: PPE Selection
sections.text: Select PPE based on anticipated exposure: gloves, gown, mask/eye protection when splash/spray is possible.

sections.heading: Respiratory Hygiene
sections.text: Implement respiratory hygiene/cough etiquette and source control when respiratory symptoms are present.

sections.heading: Contact Precautions
sections.text: Use Contact Precautions for pathogens spread by direct/indirect contact; dedicate equipment and clean high-touch surfaces.

sections.heading: Droplet Precautions
sections.text: Use Droplet Precautions for pathogens spread by respiratory droplets; use mask and eye protection per guidance.

sections.heading: Airborne Precautions
sections.text: Use Airborne Precautions for airborne pathogens; use respirator and appropriate room controls as applicable.

sections.heading: Documentation Requirements (General)
sections.text: Maintain complete, accurate documentation supporting assessment, care planning, interventions, and outcomes.

sections.heading: Survey Readiness (General)
sections.text: Be able to demonstrate policies are implemented consistently with documentation showing assessment, interventions, monitoring, and follow-up.

sections.heading: Reporting & Outbreak Coordination (General)
sections.text: Follow state reporting requirements and coordinate outbreak response, tracking, and communication per guidance.

sections.heading: Reporting Pathways (General)
sections.text: Follow required reporting pathways for incidents, allegations, and communicable diseases; document time and recipients.

sections.heading: Fever / suspected infection — Key Assessment 1
sections.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.

sections.heading: Fever / suspected infection — Key Assessment 2
sections.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.

sections.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.

sections.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.

sections.heading: Fever / suspected infection — Key Assessment 8
sections.text: Monitor temperature trends and associated symptoms; assess hydration and mental status changes.

sections.heading: Shortness of breath / low oxygen — Key Assessment 1
sections.text: Assess respiratory effort, O2 saturation, lung sounds, and response to interventions; escalate for distress.

sections.heading: Shortness of breath / low oxygen — Key Assessment 2
sections.text: Assess respiratory effort, O2 saturation, lung sounds, and response to interventions; escalate for distress.

sections.heading: Acute mental status change — Key Assessment 1
sections.text: Assess orientation, behavior change, reversible contributors, and safety risks; notify provider per protocol.

sections.heading: Acute mental status change — Key Assessment 2
sections.text: Assess orientation, behavior change, reversible contributors, and safety risks; notify provider per protocol.

sections.heading: GI symptoms (vomiting/diarrhea) — Key Assessment 1
sections.text: Assess stool/vomit frequency, hydration status, infection risk, and need for isolation precautions; monitor intake/output.

sections.heading: GI symptoms (vomiting/diarrhea) — Key Assessment 2
sections.text: Assess stool/vomit frequency, hydration status, infection risk, and need for isolation precautions; monitor intake/output.

sections.heading: Urinary symptoms — Key Assessment 1
sections.text: Assess urinary symptoms, fever, hydration, and baseline; follow protocol for provider notification and specimen collection if ordered.
